title: Create Alternative Design Version (Version 3) with Different Aesthetic

requirements.summary: Create Version 3 design preserving all existing payroll content with a completely different visual aesthetic from the current gradients/glassmorphism style
acceptanceCriteria: All existing content sections from Version 2 are preserved with identical messaging and information
Visual design uses a distinctly different aesthetic approach from the current purple-blue gradients and glassmorphism
All sections present in Version 2 (Hero, FeaturesOverview, MobileAccessSection, ComplianceSection, Footer) are included with new styling
Design maintains professional credibility appropriate for a financial/payroll service platform
New design system is applied consistently across all components and sections

file_operations.description: Replace the current purple-blue gradient and glassmorphism design system with a new modern aesthetic. Remove OKLCH gradient utilities and glassmorphism classes. Implement a clean, professional color palette appropriate for financial services (consider options like minimalist with bold typography, corporate clean with strong geometry, warm/approachable with softer colors, or dark mode with high contrast). Preserve Tailwind base imports and structure. Maintain all existing CSS custom property names for compatibility but update their values to reflect the new design direction.

Update Tailwind configuration to support the new design system. Replace the vibrant purple-blue and cyan color palette with colors that match the new aesthetic direction chosen in index.css. Update typography settings if needed to support the new visual identity (e.g., different font weights, sizes, or line heights for a minimalist or corporate look). Keep the Inter font family. Ensure border radius, spacing, and other design tokens align with the new design language. Remove or update any glassmorphism-specific utilities.

Redesign the Hero component with the new aesthetic while preserving all existing content (headline 'Payroll Made Simple & Secure', CTA buttons for 'Get Started Free' and 'Watch Demo', trust indicators). Remove animated gradient backgrounds and glassmorphism effects. Apply new styling that aligns with the chosen design direction - this may include clean geometric layouts, bold typography treatments, different background approaches (solid colors, subtle patterns, or high-contrast dark themes), and updated button styles. Preserve scroll animations if they fit the new aesthetic or replace with animations appropriate to the new design language. Maintain the same content structure and messaging.

Redesign the FeaturesOverview section with the new aesthetic while maintaining all 8 feature cards and their content. Remove glassmorphism styling and current gradient effects from the grid layout. Apply new card designs consistent with the chosen aesthetic (could be flat cards with strong shadows for corporate look, minimal bordered cards for clean design, or high-contrast cards for dark theme). Update scroll-triggered animations and staggered entrance effects to match the new design language. Preserve the CTA buttons but restyle them according to the new design system. Keep all feature descriptions and messaging identical.

Redesign the FeatureCard component to match the new design system while preserving the component API and content structure. Remove glassmorphic styling, gradient borders, and glow shadow effects. Implement new card styling appropriate to the chosen aesthetic direction - options include flat design with bold shadows, minimal borders with strong typography, warm color accents, or high-contrast dark cards. Update hover effects to be consistent with the new design language (subtle scale, border changes, or shadow shifts instead of glow effects). Preserve the optional category badge prop but restyle it. Ensure the new design maintains visual hierarchy and readability.

Redesign the MobileAccessSection with the new aesthetic while preserving all content about mobile-first payroll access across devices (smartphone, tablet, desktop). Remove glassmorphism cards and gradient styling. Apply new design treatments for the device showcase cards and platform feature highlights that align with the chosen aesthetic. Update scroll animations to fit the new design language. Maintain the same content structure emphasizing cross-device accessibility. Consider alternative ways to visually represent multi-device support (device mockups, icons, or layout patterns) that fit the new design direction.

Redesign the ComplianceSection with the new aesthetic while preserving all content about tax filing and security features. Remove glassmorphic cards, gradient backgrounds, and animated gradient borders. Apply new styling for the compliance cards that maintains professional credibility and security trust indicators. Update or replace scroll-triggered animations and hover effects to align with the new design language. Restyle the animated certification badges consistently with the new aesthetic. Maintain the same messaging about compliance, security, and certifications. Ensure the new design conveys trust and security appropriate for financial services.

Redesign the Footer component with the new aesthetic while preserving all existing content (company info, Product/Company/Support navigation links, social media icons with UTM tracking). Remove decorative gradient backgrounds and glassmorphism styling. Apply new footer design consistent with the chosen aesthetic direction - could be clean with strong dividers, minimal with subtle backgrounds, warm with softer tones, or dark with high contrast. Update link styling and hover states to match the new design system. Maintain the same information architecture and all external link tracking. Ensure footer complements the overall page design while maintaining clear content hierarchy.

requirements.summary: Implement a cohesive, modern visual theme that differentiates from gradient-heavy glassmorphism - explore minimalist bold typography, corporate clean geometry, warm approachable colors, or dark high-contrast options
acceptanceCriteria: New design direction is visually distinct from Version 2's purple-blue gradients and glassmorphism
Color palette, typography, layout patterns, and component styling create a unified visual identity
Design choice is appropriate for a professional payroll management platform
Visual hierarchy effectively guides users through content while maintaining brand trustworthiness

file_operations.description: Establish the foundational design system for Version 3 by defining a cohesive color palette, typography scale, and global styling utilities that create a unified visual identity distinct from the current gradient/glassmorphism approach. Choose one clear design direction (minimalist with bold typography, corporate clean with strong geometry, warm and approachable, or dark mode with high contrast) and implement it consistently. Define color tokens that convey professionalism and trust appropriate for financial services. Create utility classes for the new design patterns (shadows, borders, spacing, typography treatments) that will be used across all components. Ensure the foundation supports effective visual hierarchy and content flow.

Configure Tailwind to fully support the chosen design direction by extending the default theme with custom values for colors, typography, spacing, shadows, and other design tokens. Define a typography hierarchy that supports the visual identity (font sizes, weights, line heights, letter spacing). Configure shadows, border radii, and spacing scales appropriate to the chosen aesthetic. If implementing a dark theme, configure dark mode settings. Add any custom utilities needed for the new design patterns. Ensure all configuration choices reinforce the cohesive visual theme and support professional credibility for a payroll platform.
